@ccarnino Yea SpringPad is cool too.  I talked with Jeff Janer (CEO) on the TechWithMike.com podcast a while back.  They have made great improvements since then.
1instagram 2foursquare 3convore 4whatsapp 5color
@miketartaglia yes it's become a really good product. I prefer it over Evernote, because you have to be a subscriber to use the offline notes in Evernote and I cannot afford the subscription...

@ccarnino Evernote is well worth the premium subscription of 5.00/month.  I paid for a whole year which made it even cheaper.  I think it was 45.00 for the whole year.  I like both applcations, but Evernote is my primary one.  You are not stuck with Evernote if you decide to change.   You can export all your data and bring it with you.  I never use the offline notebooks.  I like to have everything every where synced and ready for me when ever I want it.  Plus it's a form of backup for all your memories.  Springpad is really a different type of note app.
